intro: Commelina phaeochaeta, commonly known as the dark-stemmed spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, dark green stems and clusters of small, blue-violet flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Commelina phaeochaeta thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands and forest understories.
